SILoadStoreOptimizer.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 //===-- SILoadStoreOptimizer.cpp ------------------------------------------===//
2 //
3 // The LLVM Compiler Infrastructure
4 //
5 // This file is distributed under the University of Illinois Open Source
6 // License. See LICENSE.TXT for details.
7 //
8 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
9 //
10 // This pass tries to fuse DS instructions with close by immediate offsets.
11 // This will fuse operations such as
12 // ds_read_b32 v0, v2 offset:16
13 // ds_read_b32 v1, v2 offset:32
14 // ==>
15 // ds_read2_b32 v[0:1], v2, offset0:4 offset1:8
16 //
17 //
18 // Future improvements:
19 //
20 // - This currently relies on the scheduler to place loads and stores next to
21 // each other, and then only merges adjacent pairs of instructions. It would
22 // be good to be more flexible with interleaved instructions, and possibly run
23 // before scheduling. It currently missing stores of constants because loading
24 // the constant into the data register is placed between the stores, although
25 // this is arguably a scheduling problem.
26 //
27 // - Live interval recomputing seems inefficient. This currently only matches
28 // one pair, and recomputes live intervals and moves on to the next pair. It
29 // would be better to compute a list of all merges that need to occur
30 //
31 // - With a list of instructions to process, we can also merge more. If a
32 // cluster of loads have offsets that are too large to fit in the 8-bit
33 // offsets, but are close enough to fit in the 8 bits, we can add to the base
34 // pointer and use the new reduced offsets.
35 //
36 //===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//
37 
38 #include "AMDGPU.h"
39 #include "SIInstrInfo.h"
40 #include "SIRegisterInfo.h"

47 #include "llvm/Support/Debug.h"
48 #include "llvm/Target/TargetMachine.h"

56 class SILoadStoreOptimizer : public MachineFunctionPass {
57 private:
58  const TargetMachine *TM;
59  const SIInstrInfo *TII;
60  const SIRegisterInfo *TRI;
61  MachineRegisterInfo *MRI;
62  LiveIntervals *LIS;

66  unsigned Offset1,
67  unsigned EltSize);

90  MachineFunctionPass(ID),

93  TRI(nullptr),

99  SILoadStoreOptimizer(const TargetMachine &TM_) :
100  MachineFunctionPass(ID),
101  TM(&TM_),
102  TII(static_cast<const SIInstrInfo*>(TM->getSubtargetImpl()->getInstrInfo())) {
103  initializeSILoadStoreOptimizerPass(*PassRegistry::getPassRegistry());
104  }

110  const char *getPassName() const override {
111  return "SI Load / Store Optimizer";

114  void getAnalysisUsage(AnalysisUsage &AU) const override {
115  AU.setPreservesCFG();
116  AU.addPreserved<SlotIndexes>();
117  AU.addPreserved<LiveIntervals>();
118  AU.addPreserved<LiveVariables>();
119  AU.addRequired<LiveIntervals>();
120 
121  MachineFunctionPass::getAnalysisUsage(AU);
122  }
123 };

139 FunctionPass *llvm::createSILoadStoreOptimizerPass(TargetMachine &TM) {
140  return new SILoadStoreOptimizer(TM);

142 
143 bool SILoadStoreOptimizer::offsetsCanBeCombined(unsigned Offset0,
144  unsigned Offset1,
145  unsigned Size) {
146  // XXX - Would the same offset be OK? Is there any reason this would happen or
147  // be useful?
148  if (Offset0 == Offset1)
149  return false;
150 
151  // This won't be valid if the offset isn't aligned.
152  if ((Offset0 % Size != 0) || (Offset1 % Size != 0))
153  return false;
154 
155  unsigned EltOffset0 = Offset0 / Size;
156  unsigned EltOffset1 = Offset1 / Size;
157 
158  // Check if the new offsets fit in the reduced 8-bit range.
159  if (isUInt<8>(EltOffset0) && isUInt<8>(EltOffset1))
160  return true;
161 
162  // If the offset in elements doesn't fit in 8-bits, we might be able to use
163  // the stride 64 versions.
164  if ((EltOffset0 % 64 != 0) || (EltOffset1 % 64) != 0)
165  return false;
166 
167  return isUInt<8>(EltOffset0 / 64) && isUInt<8>(EltOffset1 / 64);
168 }
169 
170 MachineBasicBlock::iterator
171 SILoadStoreOptimizer::findMatchingDSInst(MachineBasicBlock::iterator I,
172  unsigned EltSize){
173  MachineBasicBlock::iterator E = I->getParent()->end();
174  MachineBasicBlock::iterator MBBI = I;
175  ++MBBI;
176 
177  if (MBBI->getOpcode() != I->getOpcode())
178  return E;
179 
180  // Don't merge volatiles.
181  if (MBBI->hasOrderedMemoryRef())
182  return E;
183 
184  int AddrIdx = AMDGPU::getNamedOperandIdx(I->getOpcode(), AMDGPU::OpName::addr);
185  const MachineOperand &AddrReg0 = I->getOperand(AddrIdx);
186  const MachineOperand &AddrReg1 = MBBI->getOperand(AddrIdx);
187 
188  // Check same base pointer. Be careful of subregisters, which can occur with
189  // vectors of pointers.
190  if (AddrReg0.getReg() == AddrReg1.getReg() &&
191  AddrReg0.getSubReg() == AddrReg1.getSubReg()) {
192  int OffsetIdx = AMDGPU::getNamedOperandIdx(I->getOpcode(),
193  AMDGPU::OpName::offset);
194  unsigned Offset0 = I->getOperand(OffsetIdx).getImm() & 0xffff;
195  unsigned Offset1 = MBBI->getOperand(OffsetIdx).getImm() & 0xffff;
196 
197  // Check both offsets fit in the reduced range.
198  if (offsetsCanBeCombined(Offset0, Offset1, EltSize))
199  return MBBI;
200  }
201 
202  return E;
203 }
204 
205 void SILoadStoreOptimizer::updateRegDefsUses(unsigned SrcReg,
206  unsigned DstReg,
207  unsigned SubIdx) {
208  for (MachineRegisterInfo::reg_iterator I = MRI->reg_begin(SrcReg),
209  E = MRI->reg_end(); I != E; ) {
210  MachineOperand &O = *I;
211  ++I;
212  O.substVirtReg(DstReg, SubIdx, *TRI);
213  }
214 }
215 
216 MachineBasicBlock::iterator SILoadStoreOptimizer::mergeRead2Pair(
217  MachineBasicBlock::iterator I,
218  MachineBasicBlock::iterator Paired,
219  unsigned EltSize) {
220  MachineBasicBlock *MBB = I->getParent();
221 
222  // Be careful, since the addresses could be subregisters themselves in weird
223  // cases, like vectors of pointers.
224  const MachineOperand *AddrReg = TII->getNamedOperand(*I, AMDGPU::OpName::addr);
225  const MachineOperand *M0Reg = TII->getNamedOperand(*I, AMDGPU::OpName::m0);
226 
227  unsigned DestReg0 = TII->getNamedOperand(*I, AMDGPU::OpName::vdst)->getReg();
228  unsigned DestReg1
229  = TII->getNamedOperand(*Paired, AMDGPU::OpName::vdst)->getReg();
230 
231  unsigned Offset0
232  = TII->getNamedOperand(*I, AMDGPU::OpName::offset)->getImm() & 0xffff;
233  unsigned Offset1
234  = TII->getNamedOperand(*Paired, AMDGPU::OpName::offset)->getImm() & 0xffff;
235 
236  unsigned NewOffset0 = Offset0 / EltSize;
237  unsigned NewOffset1 = Offset1 / EltSize;
238  unsigned Opc = (EltSize == 4) ? AMDGPU::DS_READ2_B32 : AMDGPU::DS_READ2_B64;
239 
240  // Prefer the st64 form if we can use it, even if we can fit the offset in the
241  // non st64 version. I'm not sure if there's any real reason to do this.
242  bool UseST64 = (NewOffset0 % 64 == 0) && (NewOffset1 % 64 == 0);
243  if (UseST64) {
244  NewOffset0 /= 64;
245  NewOffset1 /= 64;
246  Opc = (EltSize == 4) ? AMDGPU::DS_READ2ST64_B32 : AMDGPU::DS_READ2ST64_B64;
247  }
248 
249  assert((isUInt<8>(NewOffset0) && isUInt<8>(NewOffset1)) &&
250  (NewOffset0 != NewOffset1) &&
251  "Computed offset doesn't fit");
252 
253  const MCInstrDesc &Read2Desc = TII->get(Opc);
254 
255  const TargetRegisterClass *SuperRC
256  = (EltSize == 4) ? &AMDGPU::VReg_64RegClass : &AMDGPU::VReg_128RegClass;
257  unsigned DestReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(SuperRC);
258 
259  DebugLoc DL = I->getDebugLoc();
260  MachineInstrBuilder Read2
261  = BuildMI(*MBB, I, DL, Read2Desc, DestReg)
262  .addImm(0) // gds
263  .addOperand(*AddrReg) // addr
264  .addImm(NewOffset0) // offset0
265  .addImm(NewOffset1) // offset1
266  .addOperand(*M0Reg) // M0
267  .addMemOperand(*I->memoperands_begin())
268  .addMemOperand(*Paired->memoperands_begin());
269 
270  LIS->InsertMachineInstrInMaps(Read2);
271 
272  unsigned SubRegIdx0 = (EltSize == 4) ? AMDGPU::sub0 : AMDGPU::sub0_sub1;
273  unsigned SubRegIdx1 = (EltSize == 4) ? AMDGPU::sub1 : AMDGPU::sub2_sub3;
274  updateRegDefsUses(DestReg0, DestReg, SubRegIdx0);
275  updateRegDefsUses(DestReg1, DestReg, SubRegIdx1);
276 
277  LIS->RemoveMachineInstrFromMaps(I);
278  LIS->RemoveMachineInstrFromMaps(Paired);
279  I->eraseFromParent();
280  Paired->eraseFromParent();
281 
282  LiveInterval &AddrRegLI = LIS->getInterval(AddrReg->getReg());
283  LIS->shrinkToUses(&AddrRegLI);
284 
285  LiveInterval &M0RegLI = LIS->getInterval(M0Reg->getReg());
286  LIS->shrinkToUses(&M0RegLI);
287 
288  // Currently m0 is treated as a register class with one member instead of an
289  // implicit physical register. We are using the virtual register for the first
290  // one, but we still need to update the live range of the now unused second m0
291  // virtual register to avoid verifier errors.
292  const MachineOperand *PairedM0Reg
293  = TII->getNamedOperand(*Paired, AMDGPU::OpName::m0);
294  LiveInterval &PairedM0RegLI = LIS->getInterval(PairedM0Reg->getReg());
295  LIS->shrinkToUses(&PairedM0RegLI);
296 
297  LIS->getInterval(DestReg); // Create new LI
298 
299  DEBUG(dbgs() << "Inserted read2: " << *Read2 << '\n');
300  return Read2.getInstr();
301 }
302 
303 MachineBasicBlock::iterator SILoadStoreOptimizer::mergeWrite2Pair(
304  MachineBasicBlock::iterator I,
305  MachineBasicBlock::iterator Paired,
306  unsigned EltSize) {
307  MachineBasicBlock *MBB = I->getParent();
308 
309  // Be sure to use .addOperand(), and not .addReg() with these. We want to be
310  // sure we preserve the subregister index and any register flags set on them.
311  const MachineOperand *Addr = TII->getNamedOperand(*I, AMDGPU::OpName::addr);
312  const MachineOperand *M0Reg = TII->getNamedOperand(*I, AMDGPU::OpName::m0);
313  const MachineOperand *Data0 = TII->getNamedOperand(*I, AMDGPU::OpName::data0);
314  const MachineOperand *Data1
315  = TII->getNamedOperand(*Paired, AMDGPU::OpName::data0);
316 
317 
318  unsigned Offset0
319  = TII->getNamedOperand(*I, AMDGPU::OpName::offset)->getImm() & 0xffff;
320  unsigned Offset1
321  = TII->getNamedOperand(*Paired, AMDGPU::OpName::offset)->getImm() & 0xffff;
322 
323  unsigned NewOffset0 = Offset0 / EltSize;
324  unsigned NewOffset1 = Offset1 / EltSize;
325  unsigned Opc = (EltSize == 4) ? AMDGPU::DS_WRITE2_B32 : AMDGPU::DS_WRITE2_B64;
326 
327  // Prefer the st64 form if we can use it, even if we can fit the offset in the
328  // non st64 version. I'm not sure if there's any real reason to do this.
329  bool UseST64 = (NewOffset0 % 64 == 0) && (NewOffset1 % 64 == 0);
330  if (UseST64) {
331  NewOffset0 /= 64;
332  NewOffset1 /= 64;
333  Opc = (EltSize == 4) ? AMDGPU::DS_WRITE2ST64_B32 : AMDGPU::DS_WRITE2ST64_B64;
334  }
335 
336  assert((isUInt<8>(NewOffset0) && isUInt<8>(NewOffset1)) &&
337  (NewOffset0 != NewOffset1) &&
338  "Computed offset doesn't fit");
339 
340  const MCInstrDesc &Write2Desc = TII->get(Opc);
341  DebugLoc DL = I->getDebugLoc();
342 
343  MachineInstrBuilder Write2
344  = BuildMI(*MBB, I, DL, Write2Desc)
345  .addImm(0) // gds
346  .addOperand(*Addr) // addr
347  .addOperand(*Data0) // data0
348  .addOperand(*Data1) // data1
349  .addImm(NewOffset0) // offset0
350  .addImm(NewOffset1) // offset1
351  .addOperand(*M0Reg) // m0
352  .addMemOperand(*I->memoperands_begin())
353  .addMemOperand(*Paired->memoperands_begin());
354 
355  // XXX - How do we express subregisters here?
356  unsigned OrigRegs[] = { Data0->getReg(), Data1->getReg(), Addr->getReg(),
357  M0Reg->getReg()};
358 
359  LIS->RemoveMachineInstrFromMaps(I);
360  LIS->RemoveMachineInstrFromMaps(Paired);
361  I->eraseFromParent();
362  Paired->eraseFromParent();
363 
364  LIS->repairIntervalsInRange(MBB, Write2, Write2, OrigRegs);
365 
366  DEBUG(dbgs() << "Inserted write2 inst: " << *Write2 << '\n');
367  return Write2.getInstr();
368 }
369 
370 // Scan through looking for adjacent LDS operations with constant offsets from
371 // the same base register. We rely on the scheduler to do the hard work of
372 // clustering nearby loads, and assume these are all adjacent.
373 bool SILoadStoreOptimizer::optimizeBlock(MachineBasicBlock &MBB) {
374  bool Modified = false;
375 
376  for (MachineBasicBlock::iterator I = MBB.begin(), E = MBB.end(); I != E;) {
377  MachineInstr &MI = *I;
378 
379  // Don't combine if volatile.
380  if (MI.hasOrderedMemoryRef()) {
381  ++I;
382  continue;
383  }
384 
385  unsigned Opc = MI.getOpcode();
386  if (Opc == AMDGPU::DS_READ_B32 || Opc == AMDGPU::DS_READ_B64) {
387  unsigned Size = (Opc == AMDGPU::DS_READ_B64) ? 8 : 4;
388  MachineBasicBlock::iterator Match = findMatchingDSInst(I, Size);
389  if (Match != E) {
390  Modified = true;
391  I = mergeRead2Pair(I, Match, Size);
392  } else {
393  ++I;
394  }
395 
396  continue;
397  } else if (Opc == AMDGPU::DS_WRITE_B32 || Opc == AMDGPU::DS_WRITE_B64) {
398  unsigned Size = (Opc == AMDGPU::DS_WRITE_B64) ? 8 : 4;
399  MachineBasicBlock::iterator Match = findMatchingDSInst(I, Size);
400  if (Match != E) {
401  Modified = true;
402  I = mergeWrite2Pair(I, Match, Size);
403  } else {
404  ++I;
405  }
406 
407  continue;
408  }
409 
410  ++I;
411  }
412 
413  return Modified;
414 }
415 
416 bool SILoadStoreOptimizer::runOnMachineFunction(MachineFunction &MF) {
417  const TargetSubtargetInfo *STM = MF.getTarget().getSubtargetImpl();
418  TRI = static_cast<const SIRegisterInfo*>(STM->getRegisterInfo());
419  TII = static_cast<const SIInstrInfo*>(STM->getInstrInfo());
420  MRI = &MF.getRegInfo();
421 
422  LIS = &getAnalysis<LiveIntervals>();
423 
424  DEBUG(dbgs() << "Running SILoadStoreOptimizer\n");
425 
426  assert(!MRI->isSSA());
427 
428  bool Modified = false;
429 
430  for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : MF)
431  Modified |= optimizeBlock(MBB);
432 
433  return Modified;
434 }
